item.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that the President is in violation of the War Powers Resolution regarding the use of United States Armed Forces in Libya, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.title: A joint resolution declaring that the President has exceeded his authority under the War Powers Resolution as it pertains to the ongoing military engagement in Libya.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 68.

item.title: A joint resolution declaring that the President has exceeded his authority under the War Powers Resolution as it pertains to the ongoing military engagement in Libya.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

item.title: Declaring that the President shall not deploy, establish, or maintain the presence of units and members of the United States Armed Forces on the ground in Libya, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: Directing the President, pursuant to section 5(c) of the War Powers Resolution, to remove the United States Armed Forces from Libya.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 257 - 156 (Roll no. 410). (text: CR H3990)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 257 - 156 (Roll no. 410).(text: CR H3990)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H3997)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 294.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H3990-3998)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 44.

The resolution provides 1 hour of debate for H. Res. 292. It also provides for 1 hour of debate for H. Con. Res. 51. It waives all points of order against consideration on both H. Res. 292 and H. Con. Res. 51. And, both shall be considered as read.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-99, by Mr. Scott (SC).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-99, by Mr. Scott (SC).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 292) declaring that the President shall not deploy, establish, or maintain the presence of units and members of the United States Armed Forces on the ground in Libya, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 51) directing the President, pursuant to section 5(c) of the War Powers Resolution, to remove the United States Armed Forces from Libya.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Con. Res. 51) directing the President, pursuant to section 5(c) of the War Powers Resolution, to remove the United States Armed Forces from Libya.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
